name: Art Katz
description:
Art Katz (1929 â€“ 2007)
Listen to freely downloadable audio sermons by the speaker Art Katz in mp3 format. He was radically converted by reading the New Testament. God used him to have a powerful prophetic insight into the end-times and the coming suffering of the jewish people before the great accepting of Jesus as Messiah. His eschatological insight is a very needful truth to be realized in the body of Christ. 

Art was a prophetic voice insofar as he called his listeners to purposes in God that would affect both time and eternity, purposes that had to do with the glory of God in the Church.   Frequently, his messages called the Church to an awareness of the Last Days [End-times] in such a way that made that time seem imminent and at the door.

sermons.title: "In the Beginning God created..."
sermons.description: Beginnings are always significant in the economy of God and no more so than in His creative acts. They reveal the very essence of Himself and His purpose in creating.

sermons.title: "That they may be One."
sermons.description: When we come to the same quality and character of relationship as is shown forth in the Godhead, then we will have obtained the unity of the Body. That is why a monotheistic view of God does dishonor to Him, as it does not show forth God as He is.

sermons.title: "To the Jew First..."
sermons.description: The church is emaciated and corrupted in exact proportion as it has failed to take to heart God’s foremost mandate for herself, namely, that “the gospel is the power of God unto salvation for all who believe, to the Jew first…”  There is a divine wisdom here that the Lord wants to bring to our attention.

sermons.title: (Pdf Book) Apostolic Foundations
sermons.description: Art seeks to capture the flavor and meaning of this most holy foundation. Few have adequately understood that unless the Church is built on this foundation, then it simply is not the Church in any authentic way. Includes â€œApostolic Conversionâ€. You can purchase a hard-copy of this book here: http://artkatzministries.org/online_bookstore/books/

sermons.title: (Pdf Book) Ben Israel - Odyssey of a Modern Jew
sermons.description: Written as a literal journal, Art recounts his conversion experience as an unbelieving atheist and former Marxist seeking the meaning to life, and finally apprehended in Jerusalem by the God of Israel. You can purchase a hard-copy of this book here: http://artkatzministries.org/online_bookstore/books/

sermons.title: (Pdf Book) The Spirit of Truth
sermons.description: We seek to know biblical truths, but God seeks to make us true. A deep, incisive probing into the nature of truth in an age of religious pretension, exaggeration and deception. This book calls the church back to its essential identity as the â€œground and pillar of truth.â€ You can purchase a hard-copy of this book here: http://artkatzministries.org/online_bookstore/books/

sermons.title: (The Testimony of Jesus is the Spirit of Prophecy) Against False Prophets
sermons.description: We read in the book of Jeremiah severe warnings and an outcry against prophets who have gone astray and lead God's people along with them in their web of deceit. The greatest malady in the Church today is the lack of the fear of God. May we examine ourselves to see if we are in the faith and the faith that is truly rooted in God's Word!

sermons.title: 9-11 Tragedy
sermons.description: Art tries to answer some of the issues and questions raised by the Sept. 11th, 2001 national tragedy.

sermons.title: A Bride Adorned for the Bridegroom
sermons.description: Being the Bride of Christ has everything to do with one’s identification with the One who is “acquainted with sorrows,” and it is through being joined with Him in the fellowship of His sufferings that we are fitted for our bridal role.

sermons.title: A Call to Apostolicity
sermons.description: Point by point, Art examines the distinctives of apostolic reality, so painfully absent from the Church’s consideration, but needs once again to be restored, namely, an apprehension of spiritual reality as God sees it and knows it.

sermons.title: A Call to the Church (Lazarus, Come Forth)
sermons.description:
(The Spirit of Truth), (Lazarus, Come Forth).
These two messages were spoken on the same day to one congregation. Though the themes spoken on these tapes are similar to others offered, the impact and anointing of these particular talks make them unique and worth hearing.

sermons.title: A River of Life
sermons.description: Art insists that the waters of life flowing from the Throne are available here and now for those who are yielded to that Throne and to that Lordship. As believers, why are so few of us accessing that life? Could it be we are not yielded to the totality of that Lordship?

sermons.title: And They Crucified Him
sermons.description: Empty entertainment/worship sung by pretty people -Doctrinally-correct sermons devoid of power -Sunday-only Christian lives barely distiguishable from the world All these and many more ills are symptoms of a disease Art clearly identifies in this message. It's such a fundamental thing, our understanding of the cross. It's an indictment of our lives and the current impetence of the church. In the final analysis, unless we know ‘Christ and Him crucified,’ our knowledge of God will be false.

sermons.title: Ascending the Holy Hill
sermons.description: Drawing on theologian Karl Barth’s exegesis of Psalm 24, Art examines the characteristics of the person God distinguishes as being the one who will ascend His holy hill.

sermons.title: Attaining to Sonship
sermons.description: Though God has many children, He has few "sons" in the Hebraic understanding of that word.  And He waits for a certain consecration for that crisis "crossing over" before He can say over us, "This day, I have begotten thee."

sermons.title: Be Ye Perfect
sermons.description: A revelation of the difference between the perfect and its enemy—the humanly conceived good. This is a challenge to live by a Higher Standard, His heavenly Life, in a world and a church that applauds the merely ‘good.’

sermons.title: Beyond Categories
sermons.description: How far will we allow God draw us out into a place where the ultimate revelation of Himself and His truth is?  If we cling to our “biblical correctness,” and the security of it, we will always fall short of that place of glory.  Art probes the “spiritual” elements that keep us from that ultimate surrender.

sermons.title: Beyond Culture

sermons.title: Beyond Messianic Judaism
sermons.description: Spoken at a Messianic congregation, Art presents a view of the faith that eclipses what is labeled “Messianic,” namely, an apostolic faith.  It is only in this faith, reality, power, credibility and witness that we can successfully reach the Jew in the Last Days.
sermons.preacher_description:
Art Katz (1929 â€“ 2007)
Listen to freely downloadable audio sermons by the speaker Art Katz in mp3 format. He was radically converted by reading the New Testament. God used him to have a powerful prophetic insight into the end-times and the coming suffering of the jewish people before the great accepting of Jesus as Messiah. His eschatological insight is a very needful truth to be realized in the body of Christ. 

Art was a prophetic voice insofar as he called his listeners to purposes in God that would affect both time and eternity, purposes that had to do with the glory of God in the Church.   Frequently, his messages called the Church to an awareness of the Last Days [End-times] in such a way that made that time seem imminent and at the door.

sermons.title: Birthing the Authentic
sermons.description: Everything that pertains to God's glory must be birthed from above. The birth of Jesus is the ultimate pattern of the advent of the authentic thing and it behooves us, therefore to understand the phenomenon of birth in all of its organic and painful suffering.

sermons.title: Cain and Abel (The First Murder) - Part 1
sermons.description: The righteous are those who have chosen to make themselves defenseless and weak, and choose rather to cast themselves on God. For righteousness is not righteousness unless it is a righteousness unto death, and the reason we do not seek this righteousness is because it is too costly.

sermons.title: Christ Our Life - Part 1
sermons.description: Rather than establishing our life on the basis of our own natural endowments, our gifting, our intellect, Art suggests that there is another Life that is made available for those who sincerely desire to disown their own.

sermons.title: Christ in the Jewish Passover
sermons.description: A rich study and explanation of the traditional Jewish Passover revealing Christ hidden in the many practices known to Orthodox Jews throughout the ages. It will enhance every believer's appreciation of communion as well as open their understanding about Jewish customs and practices. A wonderful tool for witnessing to Jewish people.

sermons.title: Christus Victor!
sermons.description: Jesus came to destroy the works of the Devil, and it was what was demonstrated at the Cross that is His triumph over the whole demonic realm. The early church had this perspective, and it needs to be ours at the end, for surely that same demonstration will be required. We need to see the spiritual realm as the apostles and Jesus saw it. The reality of the spiritual realm is the same as it was 2000 years ago.

sermons.title: Despising a Holy God
sermons.description: Art Kats shares from the Psalms about sinning before a Holy God. He speaks on the great subject of God's holiness and that our sins are not against others but against the thrice holy God Himself. We despise God when we do not acknowledge and follow in His commands.

sermons.title: Gleanings from the Garden - Part 1
sermons.description: What we celebrate as being good may well be our greatest snare. The world eats from the Tree of the knowledge of good and evil and the end result is death. We have got to have an unswerving devotion to the Tree of Life and abstain at all costs to draw from the Tree of the knowledge of good and evil.

sermons.title: Has Jesus made you Jewish?
sermons.description: If we miss the “Jewishness” of Jesus, we miss something crucial in our understanding of God and our testimony to both the Jew and the Gentile.  The Church has failed to communicate this “Jewishness” and therefore the Jew yet remains alienated from God.

sermons.title: Holiness or "Blessing"
sermons.description: A cautionary word for the Church regarding its fascination with the present “revival” phenomena.  Art makes the point that there is nothing more to be coveted and cherished than the sense of God as He in fact is and not as we may have thought Him to be.  If we lose this sense of God and the holiness of God, then what do we have and what is our witness?

sermons.title: In the Year King Uzziah Died

sermons.description: A probing study of the mystery of marriage, the Body of Christ and our relationship with God Himself. A radical message that has brought life and reconciliation to many.

sermons.title: Isaiah 35
sermons.description: A close and careful examination of this text reveals God’s employment of another ‘agent,’ namely, the church, as being the instrument in Israel’s deliverance and salvation in the mystery of God at the end of this age.

sermons.title: Isaiah 53
sermons.description: Though clearly Messianic in its prophetic significance, the context of this passage reveals yet another valid interpretation, namely, the nation Israel in a future fulfillment as the "suffering, servant nation." There are, therefore, obvious implications for the church.

sermons.title: Jeremiah, The Persecuted Prophet
sermons.description: Art examines the root of the offense that evoked persecution against Jeremiah, because we can likely expect it again as the church of the Last Days. sermons.title: K-048 One Thing You Lack
sermons.description: Katz here expounds upon and builds his message upon the story of the rich man's confrontation with Jesus. "Alot of us are in a much lesser place with God, because we have not understood the totality, the radical demand, the utterness of the whole commitment to God that constitutes entry into the kingdom and also entry into life". Have you yet come to the totality that is intrinsic to the call of God? After listening to this sermon, the answer will no longer elude you.

sermons.title: Priests Unto Him
sermons.description: In a self-serving world filled with an egocentric gospel, the long heard call to be priests, ministering first unto God, is being sounded again. Able to radically distinguish between the holy and the profane, it is the priest whose ministry can call down the fire of heaven and restore God’s glory to His Church. A foundational ‘must’ for every tape library. Life-changing!

sermons.title: Prophetic Reality versus Fantasy
sermons.description: How do we distinguish between the false and the true prophet as both use Scripture to validate their position? The fate of Israel was at stake in Jeremiah’s time—and so also today. Art shows that the false prophets were themselves deceived about their knowledge of God. Then, as now, nothing has changed.

sermons.title: Prudence: the Discipline of Godly Speech
sermons.description: Prudence implies a discretion that one grows in—to the degree it is valued and taken to heart. We tend to not give foresight to what we speak. It is rooted in a lust to be heard, but we will know when we are speaking prudently when peace is its fruit.

sermons.title: The Abrahamic Faith (1 of 2)
sermons.description: An in-depth study from Genesis 15 of Abraham's faith that had its birthing in a vision. God's whole theocratic design for creation rested on one man's ability to hear a voice and respond. All nations would be affected by his obedience, and as Art points out, true faith is not faith unless it is a faith unto cutting and death. This is the obedience of faith.

sermons.title: The Abrahamic Faith (2 of 2)
sermons.description: An in-depth study from Genesis 15 of Abraham's faith that had its birthing in a vision. God's whole theocratic design for creation rested on one man's ability to hear a voice and respond. All nations would be affected by his obedience, and as Art points out, true faith is not faith unless it is a faith unto cutting and death. This is the obedience of faith.
sermons.preacher_description:
Art Katz (1929 â€“ 2007)
Listen to freely downloadable audio sermons by the speaker Art Katz in mp3 format. He was radically converted by reading the New Testament. God used him to have a powerful prophetic insight into the end-times and the coming suffering of the jewish people before the great accepting of Jesus as Messiah. His eschatological insight is a very needful truth to be realized in the body of Christ. 

Art was a prophetic voice insofar as he called his listeners to purposes in God that would affect both time and eternity, purposes that had to do with the glory of God in the Church.   Frequently, his messages called the Church to an awareness of the Last Days [End-times] in such a way that made that time seem imminent and at the door.

sermons.title: The Agony and the Ecstasy of Paul in Romans 9-11
sermons.description: Why should the Church be preoccupied with God's chosen people, Israel? The reason is simply because if we do not, we will be contradicting and removing from the heart of God and His prophets, the very thing that was central to Him! This was the agony as well as the ecstasy of the apostle Paul in his epistle to the Romans. He tells us that if we are ignorant of this mystery, we are in danger of becoming wise in our own conceit. In this deeply-sobering and enlightening message, Art Katz shares on the mystery and the relationship the Church has with the Jews and how we are called to be agents of Israel's restoration!

sermons.description: Drawn from Isaiah Chap. One. A word on the status quo of a sleeping church, addressed to those in this generation who have had "their wine turned into water and their silver become dross.

sermons.title: The Anatomy of Worship

Anything less than this will lead to hardness of heart and eventually to murder in one form or another.  An excellent prophetic statement taken from the classic episode of Cain and Abel.

sermons.title: The Church as a Prophetic Presence
sermons.description: Elijah the prophet typifies and sums up the prophetic call in every generation, and is therefore a picture of the prophetic church in the Last Days. The Lord will not return "until Elijah first come and restore all things." And at the heart of the prophetic is a passionate love for truth.

sermons.title: The Compassion of God
sermons.description: The issue of mercy, not as an exertion of the moment, but what we are through and through is the thing that God is after in the Church—the word made flesh. Who are the “servants” whose pity for Israel’s ruins releases the Lord to rise up and have compassion on her, because the set time to favor Zion has come?

sermons.title: The Conflict of Two Wisdoms - Part 1
sermons.description: There are only two essential mind-sets or value systems in the world God's and that displayed by the powers of the air. This demonic realm has controverted the wisdom of God and made mankind to believe that their wisdom is where true reality is.

sermons.title: The Context of the Coming Kingdom
sermons.description: We either have an urgent expectancy of a coming, literal Kingdom on earth (and live as if we do) or we are in one way or another establishing our own little kingdoms—even “in the name of God.”

sermons.title: The Cosmic Setting

sermons.title: The Cost of Discipleship
sermons.description: The spirit of glibness, instantaneous experiences and gratification, and superficiality has entered our spiritual lives.  This message gives us the pattern of God’s way with His servants in the world. God’s Spirit not only leads, but also to give us a check.  The Lord is leading us to a relationship that we will know His voice and when He speaks, we will go. We must crucify our flesh, our fears, and just follow Him. Art gives examples both from his own life and Scripture of the Spirit of God leading.

sermons.title: The Cross Of Christ - Part 1
sermons.description: Just like Isaiah saw the Lord on a throne, high and lifted up, beholding the train of the his glory, and as a result Isaiah came to apprehend what he was.  So also we need an apprehension of God as demonstrated through the cross to know what we are.  If we are not able to behold the cross, and see how God demonstrated himself, how will our idolitries be abolished?  To the degree that our perception of God is distorted, so also are we distorted.  With unconventional wisdom, Art Katz relishes in all that the cross will afford its most ardent adherents.  He bids the church to drop their porcelain and sentimental attachments to creedal views of Calvary.  We are warned in this sermon that a Christianity which is ever fixated upon the initial salvation level the cross affords, will never challenge the status quo in this world.

sermons.title: The Cross Of Christ - Part 2
sermons.description: It has been said that, “Absolute power corrupts absolutely.”  In this sermon, Art Katz adapts this catchphrase to fit the  context of the night Christ displayed who he was through his sufferings, “Crisis reveals and absolute crisis reveals absolutely.”  In the face of their Lord hanging upon a tree, the disciples were confronted with an absolute crisis which divulged who they really were.  From the garden on through the resurrection circumstances revealed.  No more were they boasting of their capacity to be the greatest.  During the dark night of the crisis of the Christ, all was revealed.  It is in this that the Apostle Paul gloried, nothing other than the cross of Christ, for nothing else has the capacity to reveal what we are.   The sufferings of Christ, viewed with sincerity, will always beget personal revelation.  We must be apprehended by the cross.  If this is not the case, then we will be absolutely unable to serve God in any form of spiritual community.  Just like it was a suffering for Christ to display the truth of who he was, so also, our apprehension of the truth of what we are will be suffering.
sermons.preacher_description:

sermons.title: The Cross Of Christ - Part 3
sermons.description: Starting with a quote from C.H. Spurgeon, "Jesus bears not the cross so that you may escape it, but that you may endure it," this sermon delivers a message which adopts and adheres the previous two messages into our own bearing of the cross.  It is stated herein that one of the greatest libels against the cross in our day is the idea that the believer in the cross is absented from any form of suffering.  It is the cruciform life which will generate a necessary friction against the kingdoms of this world.  We must apprehend that this conflict is an intention of God through his people, and in every sense, a diet of the things of this world will by nature slicken any apprehension of this cross-centered friction.   The hearing of this sermon in its deepest of intentions will bring you face to face with Jesus calling you Satan, that is to say...you are Satanic if you cherish not the things of God over the things of man. We are admonished to take up the cross and follow Christ for, "Natural man is always the instrument by which Satanic things are brought into being in the collision between kingdoms."

God used him to have a powerful prophetic insight into the end-times and the coming suffering of the jewish people before the great accepting of Jesus as Messiah. His eschatological insight is a very needful truth to be realized in the body of Christ. 

Art was a prophetic voice insofar as he called his listeners to purposes in God that would affect both time and eternity, purposes that had to do with the glory of God in the Church.   Frequently, his messages called the Church to an awareness of the Last Days [End-times] in such a way that made that time seem imminent and at the door.

sermons.title: The Feast Of The Passover
sermons.description: Katz shares with a group of Christians they symbolic signifigance of the jewish sedar passover supper. This is very important for Christians to understand and realize much of the jewish customs and pracitces, it will greatly aid in our understanding the scriptures and the people in the scriptures.

sermons.title: The Formation of an Apostle
sermons.description: God's way is timeless in the preparation of those who are called to His own purposes. An episode out of the life of Moses that would give him the ability to lead Israel through the wilderness, namely, the ability to communicate God as God.

sermons.title: The God who Devastates
sermons.description: Art Katz speaks prophetically using the holocaust and the sufferings of Job applying it to the Church and the need of repentance. If Divine reality is to come into the church in its present unreal condition, then we need to expect devastations in our midst of the deepest and challenging kind.  The text is from the suffering of Job.

sermons.title: The Holocaust and Christian Conscience
sermons.description: Why does God allow the Holocaust and all human suffering to take place? This is the ultimate question. The necessary truth of God’s judgment and an inescapable requirement of true repentance for true faith unto salvation, are at the heart of the answer. This message relates the Holocaust to the historical rejection of God. A vital and challenging message for the Jewish people and the Church given at the national Charismatic Conference at Kansas City in 1977 as a historic event!

sermons.title: The Holy Ark of God
sermons.description: The opening address of the Shekinah Conference in 1974 at Columbia University, N.Y., tracing the call of God’s people. The final destination of the Ark is our destiny as well.

sermons.title: The Knowledge of God
sermons.description: The true knowledge of God is everything, and God is known primarily in His covenant relationship to Israel and His acts toward her. Art contends that this knowledge is different from any kind of speculative pondering on the character traits of God.

sermons.title: The Law and the Commandments
sermons.description: We have not understood the absoluteness of the moral requirements of God, nor are we emphatic about performing them by the grace that God Himself is only too willing to give.

sermons.title: The Lordâ€™s Coming in the Clouds
sermons.description: The Lord seems to come exclusively in clouds, and we need to understand what these clouds mean or we will not see Him as He desires to be seen.  The true seeing of God in His glory, which is the only true way of seeing Him, must always require a coming in the clouds.

sermons.title: The Love Of The Truth
sermons.description: Art Katz speaks on the very important issue of loving the truth and weighing such with modern revival movements where experience is elevated beyond the truth and God it represents. He gives a prophetic cautionary word towards the Toronto blessing as a new supposed revival movement and gives Biblical truth to help us navigate these muddied waters. Do you have a love of the truth? Loving the God of truth?

sermons.title: The Mystery of Israel (A 1999 convocation tape)
sermons.description: Art probes the perplexity of the mystery of Israel given in Romans 11 and Psalm 102.  It is a mystery that profoundly affects the contemporary Gentile church and the only mystery that carries a penalty for our willful ignorance of it.

sermons.title: The Obedience of Sonship
sermons.description: To go from faith to faith, is to grow from obedience to obedience.  This sermon discusses how the Lord will grant the power of His Spirit to those who are growing in this obedience.  It is through this process that the character of God will be granted to his sons and daughters.  It is a sign of maturity when one recognizes that their obedience’s will be misconstrued by others.   Halfway through this file is a question and answer time where both Art Katz and Simon Hensman field concerns and curiosities raised by believers in Singapore.
sermons.preacher_description:
Art Katz (1929 â€“ 2007)
Listen to freely downloadable audio sermons by the speaker Art Katz in mp3 format. He was radically converted by reading the New Testament. God used him to have a powerful prophetic insight into the end-times and the coming suffering of the jewish people before the great accepting of Jesus as Messiah. His eschatological insight is a very needful truth to be realized in the body of Christ. 

Art was a prophetic voice insofar as he called his listeners to purposes in God that would affect both time and eternity, purposes that had to do with the glory of God in the Church.   Frequently, his messages called the Church to an awareness of the Last Days [End-times] in such a way that made that time seem imminent and at the door.

sermons.title: The Origin of True Preaching
sermons.description: How do we know whether the preached word has its origin in God? A brief commentary from Jeremiah 23 reveals where in fact this word must come from. Art exhorts us to know what that place is and how we enter it—or our speaking will necessarily be false.

sermons.title: The Origin of the Nations
sermons.description: The nations are not a geographical accident, but distinctively given in the creative work of God. Israel, however, is the provision of God for the redemption of all nations. Out of Abraham was to come a seed and a nation, and out of that nation an enduring Kingdom.

sermons.title: The Place of Seeing
sermons.description: There is a place that God invites us to come, the holiest place of all, where God is, and it is out of that place that true, priestly service is made.

sermons.title: The Radical Controversy
sermons.description: "A Judaism that neglects or rejects Jesus the Messiah is, ipso facto, null and void, and is even in opposition to the truth of God." Can we say that to the Jew in love? It was the Church's predicament at the first and will be so in the Last Days when the scandal of the gospel is revealed. An earnest appeal.

sermons.title: The Remnant People of God
sermons.description: In the final analysis, God is mainly interested in a remnant people who stand for the whole, both for the predominantly Gentile church and Israel.  Touches the distinguishing characteristics of the remnant people of God.

sermons.title: The Rich Young Ruler and the Blind Beggar
sermons.description: Art examines the contrast of these two individuals in their ability to recognize Jesus.  The blind see and the rich go empty away. Art brings the significance of this episode into an endtimes scenario.  Definitely an all-time epochal message.

sermons.title: The Scandal of Specificity
sermons.description: The world hates a God who is specific about the things He chooses, for example, the nation Israel (the least of all peoples), Zion (a tiny hill - not a mountain), a stable (the birthplace of Messiah) and Calvary (a garbage dump) for the greatest revelation of Himself. A God who chooses is central to an understanding of the faith. Another incisive expression of God's choice of Israel with an excellent 'questions and answers' session at the end.

sermons.title: The Tent of Shem
sermons.description: God has appointed a tent as being symbolic of the ultimate union He calls us to.  It is only our own unbelief and prejudice that resists and does not ‘bow’ to this glorious condition of relationship.

sermons.title: The Theocratic Kingdom
sermons.description: With all the emphasis on ‘revival’ presently occurring, Art examines what true revival should lead to, namely, a mode of apostolic understanding that identifies with and embraces the imminent coming Kingdom—the rule of God in the earth.  The message touches on the subject of spiritual authority and sonship.

sermons.description: A comprehensive overview of a soon-coming event. Drawing on the prophetic scriptures, Art brings to the church a framework of understanding of what it will take for present-day Jacob to become the Israel of God.
sermons.preacher_description:

God used him to have a powerful prophetic insight into the end-times and the coming suffering of the jewish people before the great accepting of Jesus as Messiah. sermons.title: There were two trees in the Garden - Part 1
sermons.description: If the Tree of Life was as equally accessible to Adam and Eve, why did they scorn and reject that tree, and prefer instead to eat from the Tree of the Knowledge of Good and Evil? Is the Tree of Life equally unattractive today, and why are we disposed to the thing that seems outwardly attractive? With an introduction on the ‘cleaving’ of man to woman.

sermons.title: Turning Aside to See
sermons.description: Are we disposed to ask why "the bush is burning yet is not consumed?" God is found in the "ordinary" and "mundane." It is right here that God gives purpose and significance to our lives¾if we are willing to say: "Here am I."

sermons.title: Wandering Jew Comes Home
sermons.description: Art Katz shares his testimony in a Kathryn Kuhlman crusade or gathering. This is an older recording and Katz is just beginning his ministry to the 2.5 million Jews in New York City. This testimony is very powerful and really shows the working of divine truth in a soul of a man.

sermons.title: What a Jew does with Jesus
sermons.description: Art's dramatic testimony as an intellectually, sophisticated atheist being brought to a crisis in his search for a personal answer and finding it finally in Jerusalem.

sermons.title: What if..?
sermons.description: Art raises the questions that few are courageous enough to ask, namely, the actual truth of our condition before God. Do we see ourselves as God sees us or are we satisfied with our own subjective assessment of ourselves? And where does that leave us if we prefer the latter?

sermons.title: What is a Good Work
sermons.description: Any work which does not have its genesis in the matrix of God’s rest is nothing short of evil, even a work that appears to be successful, or has a significant numerical impact.  Art Katz points out the bitter irony that Sunday is often the most frenetic of days for God’s children.  Herein lies an exhortation to seriously consider what a work of God really is, and what will truly glorify him.  In order to truly cover the naked, and be Eunuch’s for God, we must operate out of his utter rest.

sermons.title: Widows and Slaves Indeed
sermons.description: Art addresses the little understood subject of what constitutes a true widow and the place of slavery in Paul's time, as applicable now as it was then. There is an understanding beyond what our natural eye sees, and it is into this realm that God wants to draw us the genius of what is apostolic.
